title: The Example Scene
description: This is the example scene that ships with ARtefact. You can configure another scene by adding a folder to your public/models/ folder that contains a config.json and required resources

annotations.subtitle: Information
annotations.title: About the ship
content: Welcome to ARtefact! As you can see, the model is displayed in a 3D scene along with the annotations. These annotations can have a custom icon (see the "icon" property in the config.json in the "public/models/example/" folder).
You can also separate your content in paragraphs by adding a new string to the "content" array. Each annotation can feature an image to display other content. More media types like video are planned.

annotations.subtitle: A life on board
annotations.title: The crew
content: Welcome to ARtefact! Each annotation has a custom icon, that is also present in the info layer that is shown when you click an annotation. There are multiple open-source and license-free icons you can download. For example, ARtefact uses Ionicons, a free and MIT licensed icon pack.

annotations.title: The model
content: You can also omit the media altogether and just focus on writing text content for your viewers. You are free to use zero or as many annotations as you need. Just be aware that too many annotation can look cluttered.

annotations.title: The features
content: You can also use a connecting line between your model and your annotation, to space it further apart or prevent the annotation from blocking the view on the model.

quiz.title: The Quiz
